defs.docs: Holochain's log implementation.

defs.name: prelude
defs.docs: Convenience re-export of common members

defs.name: color
defs.docs:
This is where we handle the color of the logging messages.
 Greatly inspired by the [fern](https://docs.rs/fern/0.5.8/fern/colors/index.html) crate.

defs.name: Color
defs.value: Color::{Black, Red, Green, Yellow, Blue, Magenta, Cyan, White, BrightBlack, BrightRed, BrightGreen, BrightYellow, BrightBlue, BrightMagenta, BrightCyan, BrightWhite}
defs.docs: The 8 standard colors.

defs.name: WithFgColor
defs.docs:
Opaque structure which represents some text data and a color to display it
 with.

defs.name: ColoredLevelConfig
defs.value: ColoredLevelConfig { error, warn, info, debug, trace }

attributes.value:
must_use =
  "builder methods take config by value and thus must be reassigned to variable"

defs.name: error
defs.docs: The color to color logs with the [`Error`] level.

defs.name: warn
defs.docs: The color to color logs with the [`Warn`] level.

defs.name: info
defs.docs: The color to color logs with the [`Info`] level.

defs.name: debug
defs.docs: The color to color logs with the [`Debug`] level.

defs.name: trace
defs.docs: The color to color logs with the [`Trace`] level.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Creates a new ColoredLevelConfig with the default colors.

defs.name: color
defs.docs:
Colors the given log level with the color in this configuration
 corresponding to it's level.

defs.name: get_color
defs.docs: Retrieves the color that a log level should be colored as.

defs.name: pick_color
defs.docs:
Pick a color from: "green", "white", "yellow", "white", "blue", "magenta"
 or "cyan" based on a provided text.

defs.name: rule
defs.docs: Log filtering facility: add the capability to filter out by regex log messages and/or colorize them.

defs.name: RuleFilter
defs.docs: This is our main way to filter out or colorize log messages.

defs.name: exclude
defs.docs: Returns if we should exclude this log entry or not.

defs.name: get_color
defs.docs: Returns the color of the log entry.

defs.name: should_log
defs.docs: Returns true if we should log this sentence.

defs.name: RuleFilterBuilder
defs.docs: [RuleFilter] builder following the builder pattern.

defs.name: FastLogger
defs.docs: The logging struct where we store everything we need in order to correctly log stuff.

defs.name: level
defs.docs: Returns the current log level defined. Can be one of: Trace, Debug, Info, Warn or Error.

defs.name: rule_filters
defs.docs: Returns all the *rules* defined.

defs.name: should_log_in
defs.docs:
Returns the color of a log message if the logger should log it, and None other wise.
 We want to return the last match so we can combine rules and filters.

defs.name: add_rule_filter
defs.docs:
Add a rule filter to the list of existing filter. This function has to be called before
 registering the logger or it will do nothing because the logger becomes static.

defs.name: flush_filters
defs.docs:
Flush all filter from the logger. Once a logger has been registered, it becomes static and
 so this function doesn't do anything.

defs.name: flush
defs.docs: Flushes the write buffer inside the logging thread.

defs.name: shutdown
defs.docs: Gracefully shutdown the logging thread and flush its writing buffer.

defs.name: FastLoggerBuilder
defs.docs: Logger Builder used to correctly set up our logging capability.

defs.name: new
defs.docs:
It will init a [FastLogger] with the default argument (log level set to
 [Info](log::Level::Info) by default).

defs.name: from_toml
level
defs.docs:
Returns the [verbosity level](log::Level) of logger to build. Can be one of:
 [Trace](Level::Trace), [Debug](Level::Debug), [Info](Level::Info),
 [Warn](Level::Warn) or [Error](Level::Error).

defs.name: set_level
defs.docs:
Set the [verbosity level](log::Level) of the logger.
 Value can be one of: [Trace](Level::Trace), [Debug](Level::Debug), [Info](Level::Info),
 [Warn](Level::Warn) or [Error](Level::Error).

defs.name: set_level_from_str
defs.docs:
Set the [verbosity level](log::Level) of the logger from a string value: Trace, Debug,
 Info, Warn or Error.

defs.name: set_channel_size
defs.docs:
Sets the capacity of our bounded message queue (i.e. there is a limit to how many messages
 it can hold at a time.). By default we use a queue of 1024.

defs.name: timestamp_format
defs.docs: Customize our logging timestamp.

defs.name: add_rule_filter
defs.docs: Add filtering [rules](rule::RuleFilter) to the logging facility.

defs.name: rule_filters
defs.docs: Returns all the [rules](Rule) that will be applied to the logger.

defs.name: redirect_to_file
defs.docs: Redirect log message to the provided file path.

defs.name: file_path
defs.docs: Returns the file path of the logs in the case we want to redirect them to a file.

defs.name: build
defs.docs:
Registers a [FastLogger] as the comsumer of [log] facade so it becomes static and any further
 mutation are discarded.

defs.name: build_test
defs.docs:
Dull log build, only used for test purposes because it actually doesn't log anything by not
 registering the logger.

defs.name: init_simple
defs.docs:
Initialize a simple logging instance with [Info](Level::Info) log level verbosity or retrieve
 the level from the *RUST_LOG* environment variable and no rule filtering.
